topic.title: Installing Couchbase Server
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server installation covers pre-installation, installation on supported platforms, post-installation, upgrading, cloud deployment and migration procedures.

section.title: Select Couchbase Server edition
section.p: Couchbase Server comes in two different editions: Enterprise Edition and Community Edition. There are some differences between them:

ul.li: Enterprise Edition (EE) is the latest stable version of Couchbase Server, which includes all the bug fixes and has passed a rigorous QA process. It is free for use for testing and development purposes. You need to purchase an annual support plan with this edition for production use.To contact Couchbase sales office, send email to sales@couchbase.com or call 650-417-7500.

Community Edition (CE) lags behind the EE by about one release cycle and does not include all the latest fixes or commercial support. However, it is open source and entirely free for use in testing and, if youâ€™re very brave, in production. This edition is appropriate for enthusiasts and non-critical systems.

section.p: Once you are ready to give Couchbase Server a hands-on try, download the appropriate installation package for your system.
